client

Class SpectrangleTUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.SpectrangleTUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class SpectrangleTUI
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    A class representing the textual user interface of a game of spectrangle.
    Author:
    pmbos

      • showTiles

        public void showTiles(Player player,
                      boolean showNumbers)
        Writes a string representation of the given player's tiles to standard output. Possibly with selection numbers below.
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose tiles to print.
        showNumbers - the indicator used to determine if selection numbers should be shown.

      • askForMoveType

        public java.lang.String askForMoveType()
                                throws EndOfProgram
        Asks the user which move to make (skip or replace) if said user cannot make a move.
        Returns:
        a single character representation of the type of move to make.
        Throws:
        EndOfProgram - when the program ended.

      • askForIndex

        public int askForIndex()
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       EndOfProgram
        Asks the player to select an index to place a tile on.
        Returns:
        the index the user specified.
        Throws:
        EndOfProgram - when the program ended.
        java.io.IOException - when the client cannot read from the stream.

      • askForPermutation

        public int askForPermutation(Tile tile,
                             int index)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                             EndOfProgram
        Asks the user which permutation to use.
        Parameters:
        tile - the tile whose permutations to consider.
        index - the index of the field upon which the tile is to be placed.
        Returns:
        the number (0, 1, 2) representing the rotation of the tile.
        Throws:
        EndOfProgram - when the program ended.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - when the user enters an invalid integer.
        java.io.IOException - when the client cannot read from the stream.

      • tellUserMoveMade

        public void tellUserMoveMade(java.lang.String name,
                             Tile tile,
                             int index,
                             int rotation)
        Tels the user what move has been made based on the given name, tile, index and rotations.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the player that made the move.
        tile - the tile the player moved.
        index - the index the player moved the tile to.
        rotation - the rotation the tile has on the field.

      • tellUserSkipped

        public void tellUserSkipped(java.lang.String name)
        Tells the user that a move has been skipped.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the player who skipped their move.

      • tellUserFinalResults

        public void tellUserFinalResults(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String score)
        Tells the user the final results of the game.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the player.
        score - the score belonging to the player.

      • tellUserPlayerKicked

        public void tellUserPlayerKicked(java.lang.String name,
                                 boolean canContinue)
        Tells the user a player has been kicked and checks if the game can continue.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the player who has been kicked.
        canContinue - the flag indicating if the game can continue.

      • tellUserExchanged

        public void tellUserExchanged(java.lang.String name,
                              Tile old)
        Tells the user that a player has exchanged one of their tiles.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the player who exchanged a tile.
        old - the tile they exchanged.

                    int index,
                    int rotation)
        Sets a tile to the client's board.
        Parameters:
        tile - the tile to set.
        index - the index to set the tile on.
        rotation - the rotation the tile should have.

      • askContinue

        public boolean askContinue()
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           EndOfProgram
        Asks the user if they want to play another game.
        Returns:
        true if answered in the affirmative, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the client is unable to read from the input stream.
        EndOfProgram - when the program has been ended.

                            java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                            EndOfProgram

        Parameters:
        player - the player to add.
        Returns:
        the selected strategy.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the client was unable to read from the input stream.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - when the client did not enter a valid integer.
        EndOfProgram - when the program was ended.
